item.title: 独家报道：马斯克把租来的车收回去 好让特斯拉把它们用作 "机器人轴"相反，特斯拉把它们卖掉了
item.description: 特斯拉去年 11 月结束了一项不寻常的政策，该政策禁止美国租赁客户在租期结束时购买汽车。【原文：Tesla last November ended an unusual policy that prohibited U.S. leasing customers from buying their cars at lease-end.】

item.title: Coinbase 称网络犯罪分子窃取了部分客户的账户数据
item.description: 加密货币交易所 Coinbase 周四表示，网络犯罪分子窃取了其 "一小部分 "客户的账户数据。【原文：Crypto exchange Coinbase said on Thursday cyber criminals had stolen account data for a "small subset" of its customers.】

item.title: 早间竞标：又一个胜利
item.description: 欧洲、中东和非洲市场即时新闻编辑阿曼达-库珀（Amanda Cooper）对美国和全球市场的未来一天进行展望。【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets by EMEA markets breaking news editor Amanda Cooper.】

item.title: 联合健康股价在收到刑事调查报告后下跌
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》报道，美国司法部正在调查美国联合健康集团（UnitedHealth Group）可能存在的医疗保险欺诈行为，该公司股价在周四的盘前交易中下跌了近 6%。【原文：UnitedHealth Group shares fell nearly 6% in premarket trading on Thursday, after the Wall Street Journal reported that the U.S. Department of Justice was investigating the company for potential Medicare fraud.】

item.title: 需求疲软，迪尔下调年度利润预期下限
item.description: 迪尔公司（Deere & Co）周四下调了年度利润预期的下限，原因是农民选择租用拖拉机，导致拖拉机需求疲软。【原文：Deere & Co cut the lower end of its annual profit forecast on Thursday over softer demand for its tractors from farmers opting to rent machines instead.】

item.title: Dick's Sporting Goods 将以 24 亿美元收购 Foot Locker
item.description: 迪克体育用品公司（Dick's Sporting Goods）周四表示，已同意以 24 亿美元的价格收购规模较小的竞争对手 Foot Locker。【原文：Dick's Sporting Goods has agreed to buy smaller rival Foot Locker for $2.4 billion, the companies said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美联储重新审视战略，鲍威尔对就业市场的倾斜受到关注
item.description: 越来越多的证据表明，劳动力市场紧缩并不一定会推动通胀，而且 2020 年还将面临大量失业，因此美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔监督美国央行战略的转变，更加重视充分就业的目标，并承诺不会将低失业率本身作为加息的理由。【原文：With mounting evidence that tight labor markets do not necessarily boost inflation and facing massive job losses in 2020, Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell oversaw a shift in U.S. central bank strategy that put more weight on the goal of full employment and pledged not to use a low jobless rate as a reason in itself to raise interest rates.】

item.title: 反对 OpenAI 重组的组织对新的改造计划表示担忧
item.description: 一个反对 OpenAI 重组的组织本周在一封信中写道，这家初创公司的新组织计划仍然不足以保护 ChatGPT 的创造者，避免产生危险的人工智能技术。【原文：A group that opposed OpenAI's restructuring wrote in a letter this week that the startup's new organizational plan still does not go far enough to safeguard the ChatGPT creator from generating dangerous artificial intelligence technology.】

item.title: 摩根大通投资者希望明确关税影响和继任计划
item.description: 在经济不确定性依然存在的情况下，摩根大通银行的投资者将在周一的投资者日上热切地了解这家美国最大的贷款机构和世界最大的经济体将如何受到美国对其贸易伙伴征收关税的影响。【原文：JPMorgan Chase investors will be keen to learn how the largest U.S. lender and the world's biggest economy are likely to be impacted by U.S. tariffs on its trading partners at the bank's investor day on Monday as economic uncertainty remains.】

item.title: 蚂蚁金服集团季度利润同比下降 31.4%至 54 亿元人民币
item.description: 路透社根据阿里巴巴集团控股公司周四发布的财报计算显示，截至12月31日的三个月里，中国蚂蚁金服集团实现净利润54亿元（7.49亿美元），同比下降31.4%。【原文：China's Ant Group posted net profit of 5.4 billion yuan ($749 million) for the three months to December 31, down 31.4% from a year earlier, Reuters calculations based on Alibaba Group Holdings' earnings released on Thursday showed.】

item.title: 美国股指期货下滑，关税涨势减弱，联合健康下滑
item.description: 美国股指期货周四下滑，原因是中美关税休战推动的涨势似乎有所缓解，而 UnitedHealth 则在美国司法部对该医疗保险公司进行调查的报道后下跌。【原文：U.S. stock index futures slipped on Thursday as a rally fueled by the U.S.-China tariff truce appeared to ease, while UnitedHealth fell after a report of a DoJ investigation into the health insurer.】

item.title: TikTok 被控违反欧盟网络内容规则
item.description: 继去年 2 月启动调查后，TikTok 周四被欧盟技术监管机构指控违反了欧盟网络内容规则。【原文：TikTok was charged by EU tech regulators on Thursday with breaching EU online content rules following an investigation launched in February last year.】

item.title: 阿迪达斯首席执行官称总部已完成大部分裁员工作
item.description: 阿迪达斯首席执行官比约恩-古尔登（Bjoern Gulden）周四告诉股东们，阿迪达斯已经完成了对这家德国体育用品零售商位于慕尼黑郊外的总部的大部分裁员计划。【原文：Adidas has completed the majority of planned cuts to its workforce at the German sportswear retailer's headquarters outside Munich, CEO Bjoern Gulden told shareholders on Thursday.】

item.title: 日产汽车首席执行官敦促加快日美贸易谈判
item.description: 日产汽车公司首席执行官伊万-埃斯皮诺萨（Ivan Espinosa）周四表示，他期待日本贸易谈判人员在日本与美国的贸易谈判中加快步伐，并补充说，他希望能为日本汽车制造商澄清贸易规则。【原文：Nissan CEO Ivan Espinosa said on Thursday he expects Japanese trade negotiators to move more quickly in the country's trade negotiations with the United States, adding he hoped to get clarity on trading rules for the Japanese automaker.】

item.title: 阿里巴巴季度营收不及预期
item.description: 中国电子商务巨头阿里巴巴周四公布的季度营收不及华尔街预期，该公司正在制定新的战略，以在经济持续疲软和全球贸易不确定的情况下保持消费者消费。【原文：Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba reported quarterly revenue that missed Wall Street estimates on Thursday, as the firm works on new strategies to keep consumers spending amid persistent economic weakness and global trade uncertainties.】

item.title: 尽管存在贸易战，中国的产量上限仍将支撑铝业发展
item.description: 分析师说，与贸易紧张局势有关的铝需求疲软可能会拖累今年的铝价，但中国长期以来的产量上限可能会限制铝价的跌幅。【原文：Weakness in aluminium demand linked to trade tensions will likely weigh on prices this year, but a longstanding cap on Chinese output could limit losses, analysts said.】

item.title: 英国赛捷公司称，关税 "噪音 "导致企业客户消费缓慢
item.description: 英国软件公司赛捷（Sage）表示，其小型企业客户有现金，但由于美国关税带来的不确定性而不愿花钱，尽管该公司周四坚持其全年增长预测。【原文：British software company Sage said its small business customers have cash but are reluctant to spend it because of uncertainty linked to U.S. tariffs, although it on Thursday stuck to its full-year growth forecast.】

item.title: 中国指责美国 "滥用 "对华为人工智能芯片的出口管制措施
item.description: 中国周四指责美国 "滥用出口管制措施"，并敦促华盛顿纠正其做法，因为美国发布了警告企业不要使用华为Ascend人工智能芯片的指导意见。【原文：China on Thursday accused the United States of "abusing export control measures" and urged Washington to correct its practices after the U.S. issued guidance warning companies not to use Huawei's Ascend AI chips.】

item.title: 勃肯司得（Birkenstock）上调年度预期，原因是市场对其价格较高的鞋类需求强劲
item.description: 德国鞋类制造商 Birkenstock 周四上调了全年业绩预期，原因是第二季度销售额增长超过预期，而且该公司认为市场对其价格较高的凉鞋和木屐系列需求强劲。【原文：German footwear maker Birkenstock raised its annual forecasts on Thursday, as second-quarter sales grew more than expected and the company sees strong demand for its pricier range of sandals and clogs.】

item.title: 独家报道为规避美国关税，Shein 将在越南建立大型仓库
item.description: 此举可降低其在不可预测的中美贸易紧张局势中的风险敞口。【原文：The move could reduce its exposure to unpredictable US-China trade tensions.】

item.title: 欧元区经济增长下调，但就业率保持稳定
item.description: 欧盟统计局（Eurostat）周四公布的数据显示，欧元区第一季度经济增长速度低于最初估计，但就业率保持良好，这表明尽管多年来欧元区经济扩张乏力，但该集团仍在不断创造就业机会。【原文：The euro zone economy grew slower in the first quarter than initially estimated but employment held up well, indicating that the bloc keeps creating jobs despite years of anaemic expansion, data from Eurostat showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 斯泰兰特将把玛莎拉蒂生产基地迁回摩德纳老家
item.description: 汽车制造商 Stellantis 周四表示，玛莎拉蒂跑车的生产将在今年年底前从都灵的 Mirafiori 工厂转移到摩德纳。【原文：Automaker Stellantis said on Thursday that the production of Maserati sports cars will be moved from Turin's Mirafiori plant to Modena by the end of the year.】

item.title: 特朗普称美国必须先偿还债务再建立主权财富基金
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周四表示，在建立主权财富基金之前，美国需要先偿还债务，这标志着在一年内建立基金的计划可能发生转变。【原文：The U.S. needs to pay off debt before establishing a sovereign wealth fund, President Donald Trump said on Thursday, signalling a potential shift to plans to create a fund within a year.】

item.title: 美国关税冲击之后，戛纳电影市场谨慎如常
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）提议对外国制作的电影征收 100%的关税，这让买家和卖家在一片不确定的阴云下踏入今年的戛纳电影市场。【原文：Buyers and sellers are heading into this year's Cannes Film Market under a cloud of uncertainty as the initial shock of U.S. President Donald Trump's proposed 100% tariff on foreign-made films has faded into a cautious business-as-usual approach.】

item.title: 柬埔寨与美国举行贸易谈判，49% 的关税影响前景
item.description: 柬埔寨政府周四表示，柬埔寨已在华盛顿与美国举行了首轮贸易谈判，试图就特朗普政府征收的最高关税税率之一进行谈判。【原文：Cambodia has held its first round of trade talks with the United States in Washington, its government said on Thursday, as it tries to negotiate over one of the highest tariff rates imposed by the Trump administration.】

item.title: 日本炼油企业减少脱碳努力，重新关注化石燃料
item.description: 在全球转向使用更稳定、更具成本效益的化石燃料之际，日本石油公司正在缩减脱碳计划，包括氢气和合成氨项目。【原文：Japanese oil companies are scaling back decarbonisation initiatives, including hydrogen and ammonia projects, amid a global shift towards more stable and cost-effective fossil fuels.】

item.title: Stanchart 在投资银行的推动下建立美国私募股权团队
item.description: 渣打银行（Standard Chartered）周四表示，该行已成立了一个专门负责私募股权公司、对冲基金和主权财富基金的团队，作为其投资银行争取更多金融客户业务的广泛举措的一部分。【原文：Standard Chartered has created a dedicated team covering private equity firms, hedge funds and sovereign wealth funds, as part of a wider drive in its investment bank to win more business from financial clients, the bank said on Thursday.】

item.title: 国际能源署预测 2025 年剩余时间全球石油需求增长将放缓至每天 65 万桶
item.description: 国际能源机构（IEA）周四表示，经济逆风加上电动汽车（EV）创纪录的销量，将使2025年剩余时间内的全球石油需求增长降至每天65万桶。【原文：The International Energy Agency (IEA) on Thursday said that economic headwinds, combined with record sales of electric vehicles (EV), will reduce global oil demand growth to 650,000 barrels per day (bpd) for the remainder of 2025.】

item.title: 尽管日本 MUFG 第四季度利润下滑 41%，但其年度利润仍创下历史新高
item.description: 日本最大的银行集团三菱日联金融集团（Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group）在第四季度利润下降 41% 的情况下，全年净利润仍创下历史新高。【原文：Japan's largest banking group Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group clocked a record annual net profit even as fourth-quarter profit fell by 41%.】

item.title: 特朗普印度向美国提出零关税贸易协议
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周四在多哈表示，印度已向美国提出零关税的贸易协议。【原文：U.S President Donald Trump said on Thursday in Doha that India had offered the U.S a trade deal with zero tariffs.】
